metadata.Title: CVE-2017-6458 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - negligible
metadata.Description:
Multiple buffer overflows in the ctl_put* functions in NTP before 4.2.8p10and 4.3.x before 4.3.94 allow remote authenticated users to haveunspecified impact via a long variable.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-6458` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

ntp - 1:4.2.6.p5+dfsg-3ubuntu2.14.04.11
ntpdate - 1:4.2.6.p5+dfsg-3ubuntu2.14.04.11
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: ntp package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:4.2.6.p5+dfsg-3ubuntu2.14.04.11').
